titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Cecile Pineda Papers, 1959 - 1998
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2001 The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Selected portions of various journals are restricted for 72 years from date of creation of the journal. Photocopies with the selected sections deleted have been placed in the collection for researcher use.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Cecile Pineda Papers, M1176, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: San Francisco Bay Area writer, who founded and directed the troupe, Theater of Man, 1969-1981. In 1985 she made her novelist debut with the publication of FACE, and the following year saw the publication of FRIEZE. Her creative work has received the National Endowment Fiction Fellowship and her 1992 novel, THE LOVE QUEEN OF THE AMAZON, was named notable book of the year by the New York Times.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 35 holograph journals from 1959 to the present, tape and video recordings of the author's work, drafts of unpublished work, photographs, literary and professional correspondence, teaching files, publishing files, and personal files.

scopecontent.p: Contains composition of first part of FACE; journal and dream entries; as well as an unpublished account of an 1981 trip to Mexico esp., Chiapas and some locations (Zitacuaro) providing backgrounds for subsequent episodes of FACE.
